titleStmt.title: Fragments of five various manuscripts (Homiliaries, Bibles, Gadla Samāʿtāt)

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary:
I) 2 Kings 23:29-24:9 (fol. 1ra-vb), hand a II-1) Homily by Rǝtuʿa Hāymānot on St John the Baptist (fols. 4ra-vb; 6ra-11vb), hand b (cp. EMML 1763, fols. 3r-9r) II-2) A homily on the prayer of St John the Baptist (?) (fols. 5ra-vb, 11vb, incipit), hand b II-3) Unidentified homily (?) (fols. 12ra-15vb), hand b III-1) A text concerning the childhood and youth of the Virgin Mary and the birth of Christ (fols. 16ra-vb, 147ra-148va), hand c III-2) Is. 5-6 (fol. 18ra-vb), hand c III-3) Za-Ḥәzqәʾel nabiy “Of Ezekiel the Prophet” (fol. 18vb), incipit, hand c II-4) The story of Eulogius the Hospitable, from the Traditions of ʾAbbā Daniel (fols. 17ra-vb; 19ra-vb), hand b (for the Greek text, s. L. CLUGNET (ed., tr.), Vie et récits de l’abbé Daniel le Scétiote, Paris 1901 (Bibliothèque hagiographique orientale 1)) IV-1) Martyrdom of Aretha (fols. 20ra-27vb, 50ra-53vb, 67ra-74vb), hand d (s. A. BAUSI, A. GORI (ed., tr.), Tradizioni orientali del “Martirio di Areta”, Firenze 2006 (Quaderni di semitistica 27), §§ 23c-39d, 35b-39d, 13b-23c, resp.; the correct sequence is fols. 67ra-74vb, 20ra-27rb, 50ra-53vb) V-1) Homily by an anonymous author for the eight day of Pentecost (fols. 31va-33rb), hand e V-2) Homily by Bishop Theophilus [of ʾAksum] for the feast of the Meetingof Priests for 18 Miyāzyā (fols. 33rb-42ra), hand e (cp. EMML 1763 (71), Orient. 8192, no. 23) V-3) Homily on St Michael the Archangel [by Yoḥannǝs, Bishop of ʾAksum, for the month of Sane] (fols. 28ra-31rb, 42ra-48rb), hand e (cp. Orient. 8192, no. 27; s. Dәrsanä Mikāʾel wa-dәrsanä Gäbrәʾel, Addis Abäba 1954 E.C., 127ff., the correct sequence is 42ra-48rb, 28ra-31rb) IV-2) A text on marriage or Pentecost (?) (fol. 49ra-rb), explicit, hand d IV-3) Martyrdom of ʾƎmrayәs, commemorated on 14 Țerr (fols. 54ra-56rb), in full, hand d (cp. F.M. ESTEVES PEREIRA (ed., tr.), Martyrio de santa Emerayes (ama Heraei), Lisboa 1902; BudgeSyn 494-95) IV-4) Martyrdom of Filәmon, commemorated on 20 Yakkātit (fols. 56rb-60vb), in full, hand d IV-5) Martyrdom of Arsenofis, Peter and Askriyon, commemorated on 19 Sane (fols. 60vb-66vb), beginning, hand d (cp. C. CONTI ROSSINI, “La Passione del martire Arsenofis e dei suoi compagni nella versione etiopica”, Orientalia nova ser. 3, 1938, 193-214, 319-32) II-6) The Story of the Finding of the Holy Cross, for the feast of St Helena (fols. incipit 75ra-vb, 79rb-v), hand b (cp. EMML 1763 (6)) II-7) Homily by Minas, Bishop of Aksum, on the Glorious Cross (fols. 76r-v, incipit 77r-v, 78r-v, 75ra explicit, leaves in disorder), hand b (cp. EMML 1763 (3))
II-9) Homily by Minas, Bishop of Aksum, for the feast of the 70 Disciples and the 318 Orthodox Fathers of Nicea (fols. 80r-v, 81ra explicit?), hand b (EMML no. 1763 (7)) II-10) Homily by anonymous author for commemoration of the 24 Heavenly Priests (fols. 81rb-87vb), end missing, hand b (cp. EMML no. 1763 (17)) IV-6) Vita and Martyrdom of the Forty Holy soldiers of Cappadocia, commemorated on 13 Maggābit (fol. 88ra explicit, fols. 161vb-162vb beginning), incomplete, hand d (cp. BudgeSyn 690-92) IV-7) Vita and Martyrdom of Theocritus the Reader, commemorated on 17 Maggābit (fols. 88ra-94vb), end missing (cp. BudgeSyn 712-13; probably a part from Gadla Samāʿtāt) IV-8) Martyrdom of St George of Lydda (fol. 95rv), hand d (cp. E.A.W. BUDGE, The History of George of Lydda, The patron Saint of England, London 1930, pp. 87 l.18-88 l.18; the text immediately follows ms. UM-046, fol. 82rv) IV-9) Martyrdom of Aretha (fol. 96rv, in reversed position), hand d I-2) Acts 2:4-21 (fol. 97rv), hand a III-4) Is. 1 (fol. 98rv), hand c IV-10) Various texts from Gadla Samāʿtāt (?) (fols. 99ra-107vb), hand d (fol. 99: Martyrdom of Sofǝya and her three daughters ʾAlaṗis, Ṗistis and ʾAgaṗis)
V-4) Homily by Proclus of Cyzicus (Ṗäraqliṭolos za-hagärä Qozqos) on the Passions of Christ (fol. 108ra-112va), complete, hand e (not listed in HMML; Orient. 8192, no. 21, the name of the author is written in the same way)
V-5) Homily by Theophilus, Bishop of ʾAksum, for Easter (fols. 112vb-118va), complete (?), hand e (cp. EMML 1763 (67); Orient 8192, no. 22) V-6) Homily by Theophilus, Bishop of ʾAksum (ʾeṗis qoṗos za-ʾAksum), for the first Sunday after Easter (fols. 118vb-128rb), hand e (cp. EMML 1763 (68), Orient. 8192, no. 23) V-7) Homily by John Chrysostom for Ascension Day (fols. 128rb-131vb), complete (?), hand e (not listed in EAE III, 293-95; cp. Orient 8192, no. 25, without the author’s name) V-8) Homily by the Orthodox for Pentecost (fols. 131vb-138rb), end missing, hand e (cp. EMML 1763 (76), Orient. 8192, no. 26) V-9) Unidentified homily by Bishop Constantine (?) (fols. 138rb-146vb), hand e. II-11) Homily by Bishop Gregory for Christmas (fol. 148va-vb), beginning, hand b (possibly a translation of Gregory of Nazianzus, Oration 38, s. EAE II, 891b) V-10) A homily on marriage (?) (fol. 149ra-vb), hand e IV-11) A text from Gadla Samāʿtāt (?) (fols. 150ra-153vb), hand d V-10) Unidentified homily (?) (fol. 154ra-vb), hand e II-12) From the Traditions of ʾAbbā Daniel (fols. 155ra-159vb, leaves randomly sewn together), hand b (for the Greek text, s. L. CLUGENT (ed., tr.), Vie (et récits) de l’abbé Daniel le Scétiote, Paris 1901 (Bibliothèque hagiographique orientale 1) IV-12) Martyrdom of Theodotus (fols. 160ra, 161vb), hand d (cp. BudgeSyn 677-78)

supportDesc.extent: Made of 161 folios, a combination of five manuscripts.

msContents.summary: I) 2 Kings 23:29-24:9 (fol. 1ra-vb), hand a I-2) Acts 2:4-21 (fol. 97r-v), hand a

II-1) Homily by Rǝtuʿa Hāymānot on St John the Baptist (fols. 4ra-vb; 6ra-11vb), hand b (cp. EMML 1763, fols. 3r-9r) II-2) A homily on the prayer of St John the Baptist (?) (fols. 5ra-vb, 11vb, incipit), hand b II-3) Unidentified homily (?) (fols. 12ra-15vb), hand b II-4) The story of Eulogius the Hospitable, from the Traditions of ʾAbbā Daniel (fols. 17ra-vb; 19ra-vb), hand b (for the Greek text, s. L. CLUGNET (ed., tr.), Vie et récits de l’abbé Daniel le Scétiote, Paris 1901 (Bibliothèque hagiographique orientale 1)) II-6) The Story of the Finding of the Holy Cross, for the feast of St Helena (fols. incipit 75ra-vb, 79rb-v), hand b (cp. EMML 1763 (6)) II-7) Homily by Minas, Bishop of Aksum, on the Glorious Cross (fols. 76r-v, incipit 77r-v, 78r-v, 75ra explicit, leaves in disorder), hand b (cp. EMML 1763 (3))
II-9) Homily by Minas, Bishop of Aksum, for the feast of the 70 Disciples and the 318 Orthodox Fathers of Nicea (fols. 80r-v, 81ra explicit?), hand b (EMML no. 1763 (7)) II-10) Homily by anonymous author for commemoration of the 24 Heavenly Priests (fols. 81rb-87vb), end missing, hand b (cp. EMML no. 1763 (17)) II-11) Homily by Bishop Gregory for Christmas (fol. 148va-vb), beginning, hand b (possibly a translation of Gregory of Nazianzus, Oration 38, s. EAE II, 891b) II-12) From the Traditions of ʾAbbā Daniel (fols. 155ra-159vb, leaves randomly sewn together), hand b (for the Greek text, s. L. CLUGENT (ed., tr.), Vie (et récits) de l’abbé Daniel le Scétiote, Paris 1901 (Bibliothèque hagiographique orientale 1)

msItem.title: Homiliary
Homily by Rǝtuʿa Hāymānot on St John the Baptist
A homily on the prayer of St John the Baptist (?) (fols. 5ra-vb, 11vb, incipit), hand b
II-3) Unidentified homily (?) (fols. 12ra-15vb), hand b

II-4) The story of Eulogius the Hospitable, from the Traditions of ʾAbbā Daniel (fols. 17ra-vb; 19ra-vb), hand b (for the Greek text, s. L. CLUGNET (ed., tr.), Vie et récits de l’abbé Daniel le Scétiote, Paris 1901 (Bibliothèque hagiographique orientale 1))
II-6) The Story of the Finding of the Holy Cross, for the feast of St Helena (fols. incipit 75ra-vb, 79rb-v), hand b (cp. EMML 1763 (6))
II-7) Homily by Minas, Bishop of Aksum, on the Glorious Cross (fols. 76r-v, incipit 77r-v, 78r-v, 75ra explicit, leaves in disorder), hand b (cp. EMML 1763 (3))
II-9) Homily by Minas, Bishop of Aksum, for the feast of the 70 Disciples and the 318 Orthodox Fathers of Nicea (fols. 80r-v, 81ra explicit?), hand b (EMML no. 1763 (7))
II-10) Homily by anonymous author for commemoration of the 24 Heavenly Priests (fols. 81rb-87vb), end missing, hand b (cp. EMML no. 1763 (17))
II-11) Homily by Bishop Gregory for Christmas (fol. 148va-vb), beginning, hand b (possibly a translation of Gregory of Nazianzus, Oration 38, s. EAE II, 891b)

II-12) From the Traditions of ʾAbbā Daniel (fols. 155ra-159vb, leaves randomly sewn together), hand b (for the Greek text, s. L. CLUGENT (ed., tr.), Vie (et récits) de l’abbé Daniel le Scétiote, Paris 1901 (Bibliothèque hagiographique orientale 1)

msContents.summary: III-1) A text concerning the childhood and youth of the Virgin Mary and the birth of Christ (fols. 16ra-vb, 147ra-148va), hand c III-2) Is. 5-6 (fol. 18ra-vb), hand c III-3) Za-Ḥәzqәʾel nabiy “Of Ezekiel the Prophet” (fol. 18vb), incipit, hand c III-4) Is. 1 (fol. 98rv), hand c

Is. 5-6 (fol. 18ra-vb)
Za-Ḥәzqәʾel nabiy “Of Ezekiel the Prophet” (fol. 18vb), incipit,
Is. 1 (fol. 98rv)

msContents.summary: IV-1) Martyrdom of Aretha (fols. 20ra-27vb, 50ra-53vb, 67ra-74vb), hand d (s. A. BAUSI, A. GORI (ed., tr.), Tradizioni orientali del “Martirio di Areta”, Firenze 2006 (Quaderni di semitistica 27), §§ 23c-39d, 35b-39d, 13b-23c, resp.; the correct sequence is fols. 67ra-74vb, 20ra-27rb, 50ra-53vb) IV-2) A text on marriage or Pentecost (?) (fol. 49ra-rb), explicit, hand d IV-3) Martyrdom of ʾƎmrayәs, commemorated on 14 Țerr (fols. 54ra-56rb), in full, hand d (cp. F.M. ESTEVES PEREIRA (ed., tr.), Martyrio de santa Emerayes (ama Heraei), Lisboa 1902; BudgeSyn 494-95) IV-4) Martyrdom of Filәmon, commemorated on 20 Yakkātit (fols. 56rb-60vb), in full, hand d IV-5) Martyrdom of Arsenofis, Peter and Askriyon, commemorated on 19 Sane (fols. 60vb-66vb), beginning, hand d (cp. C. CONTI ROSSINI, “La Passione del martire Arsenofis e dei suoi compagni nella versione etiopica”, Orientalia nova ser. 3, 1938, 193-214, 319-32) IV-6) Vita and Martyrdom of the Forty Holy soldiers of Cappadocia, commemorated on 13 Maggābit (fol. 88ra explicit, fols. 161vb-162vb beginning), incomplete, hand d (cp. BudgeSyn 690-92) IV-7) Vita and Martyrdom of Theocritus the Reader, commemorated on 17 Maggābit (fols. 88ra-94vb), end missing (cp. BudgeSyn 712-13; probably a part from Gadla Samāʿtāt) IV-8) Martyrdom of St George of Lydda (fol. 95rv), hand d (cp. E.A.W. BUDGE, The History of George of Lydda, The patron Saint of England, London 1930, pp. 87 l.18-88 l.18; the text immediately follows ms. UM-046, fol. 82rv) IV-9) Martyrdom of Aretha (fol. 96rv, in reversed position), hand d IV-10) Various texts from Gadla Samāʿtāt (?) (fols. 99ra-107vb), hand d (fol. 99: Martyrdom of Sofǝya and her three daughters ʾAlaṗis, Ṗistis and ʾAgaṗis) IV-11) A text from Gadla Samāʿtāt (?) (fols. 150ra-153vb), hand d IV-12) Martyrdom of Theodotus (fols. 160ra, 161vb), hand d (cp. BudgeSyn 677-78)

msItem.title: Gadla samāʿtāt

Martyrdom of Aretha (fols. 20ra-27vb, 50ra-53vb, 67ra-74vb), hand d (s. A. BAUSI, A. GORI (ed., tr.), Tradizioni orientali del “Martirio di Areta”, Firenze 2006 (Quaderni di semitistica 27), §§ 23c-39d, 35b-39d, 13b-23c, resp.; the correct sequence is fols. 67ra-74vb, 20ra-27rb, 50ra-53vb)
A text on marriage or Pentecost (?) (fol. 49ra-rb), explicit, hand d
Martyrdom of ʾƎmrayәs, commemorated on 14 Țerr (fols. 54ra-56rb), in full, hand d (cp. F.M. ESTEVES PEREIRA (ed., tr.), Martyrio de santa Emerayes (ama Heraei), Lisboa 1902; BudgeSyn 494-95)
Martyrdom of Filәmon, commemorated on 20 Yakkātit (fols. 56rb-60vb), in full, hand d

Martyrdom of Arsenofis, Peter and Askriyon, commemorated on 19 Sane (fols. 60vb-66vb), beginning, hand d (cp. C. CONTI ROSSINI, “La Passione del martire Arsenofis e dei suoi compagni nella versione etiopica”, Orientalia nova ser. 3, 1938, 193-214, 319-32)
Vita and Martyrdom of the Forty Holy soldiers of Cappadocia, commemorated on 13 Maggābit (fol. 88ra explicit, fols. 161vb-162vb beginning), incomplete, hand d (cp. BudgeSyn 690-92)
Vita and Martyrdom of Theocritus the Reader, commemorated on 17 Maggābit (fols. 88ra-94vb), end missing (cp. BudgeSyn 712-13; probably a part from Gadla Samāʿtāt)

Martyrdom of St George of Lydda (fol. 95rv), hand d (cp. E.A.W. BUDGE, The History of George of Lydda, The patron Saint of England, London 1930, pp. 87 l.18-88 l.18; the text immediately follows ms. UM-046, fol. 82rv)
Martyrdom of Aretha (fol. 96rv, in reversed position), hand d
Various texts from Gadla Samāʿtāt (?) (fols. 99ra-107vb), hand d (fol. 99: Martyrdom of Sofǝya and her three daughters ʾAlaṗis, Ṗistis and ʾAgaṗis)
A text from Gadla Samāʿtāt (?) (fols. 150ra-153vb), hand d
Martyrdom of Theodotus (fols. 160ra, 161vb), hand d (cp. BudgeSyn 677-78)

msContents.summary:
V-1) Homily by an anonymous author for the eight day of Pentecost (fols. 31va-33rb), hand e V-2) Homily by Bishop Theophilus [of ʾAksum] for the feast of the Meetingof Priests for 18 Miyāzyā (fols. 33rb-42ra), hand e (cp. EMML 1763 (71), Orient. 8192, no. 23) V-3) Homily on St Michael the Archangel [by Yoḥannǝs, Bishop of ʾAksum, for the month of Sane] (fols. 28ra-31rb, 42ra-48rb), hand e (cp. Orient. 8192, no. 27; s. Dәrsāna Mikāʾel wa-dәrsāna Gabrәʾel, Addis Ababā 1954 E.C., 127ff., the correct sequence is 42ra-48rb, 28ra-31rb) V-4) Homily by Proclus of Cyzicus (Ṗarāqliṭolos za-hagara Qozqos) on the Passions of Christ (fol. 108ra-112va), complete, hand e (not listed in HMML; Orient. 8192, no. 21, the name of the author is written in the same way)
V-5) Homily by Theophilus, Bishop of ʾAksum, for Easter (fols. 112vb-118va), complete (?), hand e (cp. EMML 1763 (67); Orient 8192, no. 22) V-6) Homily by Theophilus, Bishop of ʾAksum (ʾeṗis qoṗos za-ʾAksum), for the first Sunday after Easter (fols. 118vb-128rb), hand e (cp. EMML 1763 (68), Orient. 8192, no. 23) V-7) Homily by John Chrysostom for Ascension Day (fols. 128rb-131vb), complete (?), hand e (not listed in EAE III, 293-95; cp. Orient 8192, no. 25, without the author’s name) V-8) Homily by the Orthodox for Pentecost (fols. 131vb-138rb), end missing, hand e (cp. EMML 1763 (76), Orient. 8192, no. 26) V-9) Unidentified homily by Bishop Constantine (?) (fols. 138rb-146vb), hand e. V-10) A homily on marriage (?) (fol. 149ra-vb), hand e
V-10) Unidentified homily (?) (fol. 154ra-vb), hand e

msItem.title: Homiliary
V-1) Homily by an anonymous author for the eight day of Pentecost (fols. 31va-33rb), hand e
V-2) Homily by Bishop Theophilus [of ʾAksum] for the feast of the Meetingof Priests for 18 Miyāzyā (fols. 33rb-42ra), hand e (cp. EMML 1763 (71), Orient. 8192, no. 23)

V-3) Homily on St Michael the Archangel [by Yoḥannǝs, Bishop of ʾAksum, for the month of Sane] (fols. 28ra-31rb, 42ra-48rb), hand e (cp. Orient. 8192, no. 27; s. Dәrsāna Mikāʾel wa-dәrsāna Gabrәʾel, Addis Ababā 1954 E.C., 127ff., the correct sequence is 42ra-48rb, 28ra-31rb)
V-5) Homily by Theophilus, Bishop of ʾAksum, for Easter (fols. 112vb-118va), complete (?), hand e (cp. EMML 1763 (67); Orient 8192, no. 22)
V-6) Homily by Theophilus, Bishop of ʾAksum (ʾeṗis qoṗos za-ʾAksum), for the first Sunday after Easter (fols. 118vb-128rb), hand e (cp. EMML 1763 (68), Orient. 8192, no. 23)
V-7) Homily by John Chrysostom for Ascension Day (fols. 128rb-131vb), complete (?), hand e (not listed in EAE III, 293-95; cp. Orient 8192, no. 25, without the author’s name)
V-8) Homily by the Orthodox for Pentecost (fols. 131vb-138rb), end missing, hand e (cp. EMML 1763 (76), Orient. 8192, no. 26)
V-9) Unidentified homily by Bishop Constantine (?) (fols. 138rb-146vb), hand e.
V-10) A homily on marriage (?) (fol. 149ra-vb), hand e
V-10) Unidentified homily (?) (fol. 154ra-vb)

handNote.seg: Hand e, same as hand b of UM-050
